lesson.title: 1. Setup
lesson.description: Setup OpenGL ES in Android environment.

lesson.title: 2. Triangles
lesson.description: Draw a triangle and a square (made from two triangles). Setup vertex array buffers.

lesson.title: 3. Colors
lesson.description: Color objects by using smooth coloring (triangle) or flat coloring (square).

lesson.title: 4. Rotation
lesson.description: Add animation to the scene using rotations. The two objects rotate on different axes.

lesson.title: 5. 3D Shapes
lesson.description: Go solid by turning the triangle into a pyramid and the square into a cube.

lesson.title: 6. Texture Mapping
lesson.description: Render a cube textured with a bitmap image.

lesson.title: 7. Texture Filters & Lighting
lesson.description: Build textures with different types of filtering: nearest, linear and mipmap. Uses simple lighting.

lesson.title: 8. Blending
lesson.description: Achieve the effect of transparency using blending. Introducing the 4th color component: 'alpha'.

lesson.title: 9. Bitmap Animation
lesson.description: Simple animation using blended 2D sprites. Makes heavier use of model-view transformations.

lesson.title: 16. Fog
lesson.description: One of the simplest, yet most impressive OpenGL effects. Illustrates 3 different fog filters.

lesson.title: 18. Quadrics
lesson.description: Draw complex objects like spheres, cylinders, disks and cones. Some math is used behind this.

lesson.title: 23. Sphere Mapping
lesson.description: Add reflections to the quadrics from lesson 18 by using sphere mapping. Some tricky math here too.
